subject: Management
title: The Pre-Mortem
description: A fast breakdown of The Pre-Mortem for builders.

hook.text: A team launched a product that flopped. In hindsight, everyone saw the warning signs.

buildup.text: Hindsight is 20/20. But what if you could use it before the decision?

discovery.text: Gary Klein invented the pre-mortem: imagine the project failed. Now explain why.

twist.text: People are better at explaining past failure than predicting future success.

climax.text: A 10-minute pre-mortem surfaces risks that optimism hides. Run one before every big call.

punchline.text: Imagine the funeral before you commit to the birth.

quiz.question: What is a pre-mortem?
options: Imagining a project failed and explaining why before starting
Reviewing what went wrong after a project ends
A meeting to assign blame for past failures
